52.63: If R. Yehuda, if he did not bundle it, why is it Kosher?
52.64: If it is the Rabbis, why is it a mitzvah.
52.65: It is the Rabbis. And what is the mitzvah?

52.48: But did we not teach in a Baraitha:
52.49: Of the fours species in the lulav, two of them give fruit, and two do not give fruit.
52.47: This is when he doesn't have, but if he has [all four], it doesn't prevent him from fulfilling the mitzvah.
52.45: And the four [species] in the lulav (Lev. 23:40): "And you shall take" - a complete taking.
52.58: He learned "taking" "taking" from the hyssop bundle. Just as there it is a bundle, so too here it is a bundle.
52.54: A lulav, whether in a union or not in a union, is Kosher.
52.51: And so too Israel do not appease [G-d] until they are all one union, as it is said:
52.50: Those which give fruit are connected to those which do not, and those which do not are connected to those which give fruit, and one does not fulfill his obligation until they are all in one union.
52.53: It is a Tanna, as we taught:
52.52: (Amos 9:6) "It is He that buildeth His upper chambers in the heaven, And hath founded His vault [lit. union] upon the earth"

130.10: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, One verse says (Deuteronomy 16:8) "for six days you shall eat Matzah." and another verse says (Exodus 12:15) "for seven days you shall eat Matzot". How can that be reconciled?
130.0: ......as [the verse] says "count for yourself". The counting (sefirah) is dependant on beis din (the courts). Therefore the Shabbos of creation cannot be included, because it's count is counted by everyone.
130.2: says, "From the day after Shabbos" refers to the day following Yom Tov (first day of Pesach)
130.4: it is referring to [the day after] Yom Tov, or perhaps it is referring to the day after the Shabbos of Creation (ie. Sunday)?
130.7: But it doesn't say that. Rather it says "The day after Shabbos". The entire year is full of Shabbatot (plural Shabbos). Go find out which Shabbos it is referring to.
130.6: Does the verse say "On the day after Shabbos that is during Pesach"?
130.9: Just like there it is referring to the holiday and the beginning of the holiday. So too here it is referring to the holiday and the beginning of the holiday.
130.8: Furthermore, it says "Shabbos" below, and there is a verse above that says "Shabbos".
